Description: Red glass or jasper pendant-bead in the shape of a poppy seed head, with a transversal hole for suspension at one end.
Curator's comments: Concerning glass and stone beads, see See W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 79 § 79. For complete beads of this shape, from Tell Dafana, see London, BM, EA 23470.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 79 § 79)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.85, p.186, pl.28)
Condition: fair (incomplete :one end broken and missing, above the suspension hole)
